greenmirror

Interface CommandLineOptionHandler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HelpCommandLineOptionHandler, HostCommandLineOptionHandler, ModelCommandLineOptionHandler, PortCommandLineOptionHandler, TraceCommandLineOptionHandler

    public interface CommandLineOptionHandler
extends java.lang.Cloneable
    The interface that encapsulates all command line argument handlers. All implementing classes should have at least one of the ClientSide and ServerSide annotations to indicate on which part of the application they are used. Command line options are processed by JOpt Simple and thus the syntax tries to honor the syntaxes of POSIX getopt() and GNU getopt_long(). A note on terminology: all different strings passed on the command line are called the options. For example: greenmirror.client.Client --option1 --option2 All parameters belonging to options are called arguments. For example: greenmirror.client.Client --option1=argument1 -o argument2
    Author:
    Karim El Assal
    See Also:
    JOpt Simple

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  CommandLineOptionHandler.FatalException
      An Exception thrown when validating or processing the argument gave an exception that prohibits the continuation of the application.

    • Method Detail

      • getDescription

        @NonNull java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns:
        the description of this option

      • getOptions

        @NonNull java.util.List<java.lang.String> getOptions()
        Returns:
        the options of this option handler. For example: "help" for a help command

      • getProcessPriority

        double getProcessPriority()
        Returns the processing priority of this option handler. Option handlers with a lower priority double are handled first. There are no limits to the double, it's just that the option handlers are sorted according to their processing priority.
        Returns:
        the processing priority

      • getArgumentCount

        int getArgumentCount()
        Returns the amount of arguments this option handler accepts. This becomes relevant when allowMultiple() returns true.
        Returns:
        the amount of arguments

      • allowMultiple

        boolean allowMultiple()
        Returns:
        whether the option can be passed multiple times

      • setParserSettings

        joptsimple.OptionSpec<?> setParserSettings(@NonNull joptsimple.OptionParser optionParser)
        Sets the settings for the JOpt Simple parser. This sets settings like which options are part of this option handler (according to getOptions()), whether arguments are required and how they are described in the help message.
        Parameters:
        optionParser - the OptionParser of JOpt Simple
        Returns:
        the option specification of this option handler
        See Also:
        JOpt Simple: OptionParser

      • validate

        void validate(@NonNull GreenMirrorController controller,
              java.lang.String... arguments)
       throws CommandLineOptionHandler.FatalException
        Validates the passed arguments. It throws a FatalException if the arguments couldn't be validated. It might need the GreenMirror controller to validate the arguments.
        Parameters:
        controller - the GreenMirror controller
        arguments - the arguments of this option
        Throws:
        CommandLineOptionHandler.FatalException - if the arguments can't be validated

      • process

        void process(@NonNull GreenMirrorController controller)
      throws CommandLineOptionHandler.FatalException
        Process this option.
        Parameters:
        controller - the GreenMirror controller
        Throws:
        CommandLineOptionHandler.FatalException - if something went wrong during processing

      • clone

        @NonNull CommandLineOptionHandler clone()
        Returns:
        a new instance of this option handler
